intro: Sarcocephalus ovatus, commonly known as the African starwood, is a small evergreen tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers followed by orange-red berries that contain seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional medicinal uses. The bark and leaves are used in traditional medicine to treat various ailments.
